com.imi.j3d.loaders.flt
Class FltLoader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.sun.j3d.loaders.LoaderBase
        |
        +--com.imi.j3d.loaders.flt.FltLoader
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.sun.j3d.loaders.Loader
public class FltLoader
extends com.sun.j3d.loaders.LoaderBase

Loads OpenFLT format files (versions 15.4/15.6) into a Java3D Scene Graph

Database Nodes
Currently supported OpenFLT data include:

    HEADER       TEXT_COMMENT      VERTEX_C      TRANSLATE
    GROUP        COLOR_PALETTE     VERTEX_CN     SCALE
    OBJECT       XFORM_MATRIX      VERTEX_CNUV   ROTATE_POINT
    FACE         INSTANCE_REF      VERTEX_CUV    ROTATE_SCALE_2PT
    PUSH_LEVEL   INSTANCE_DEF      VERTEX_LIST   PUT_XFORM
    POP_LEVEL    TEXTURE_PALETTE   LOD           GENERAL_MATRIX
    DOF          VERTEX_PALETTE    ROTATE_EDGE   SWITCH
    MATERIAL_PALETTE
    EXTERNAL REFERENCES
    LONG_ID
    POLYGON TRANSPARENCY
    SEQUENCE ANIMATION
    LIGHT POINTS
    SUB_FACE
    BILLBOARD
    SOUND
Because BILLBOARDs are translated to OrientedShape3Ds, this release is only compatible when Java3D 1.2 and higher.

Any nodes not listed here are NOT implemented in this release.

No OpenFLT terrain specific data is read or stored in this release.(i.e CAT and terrain flags)

Loader Flags
There are 12 loader flags that control loader behavior: They are:
    PRINT_STATS
    FORCE_LOAD         - Default ON
    USE_FLT_OBJECTS    - Default ON
    USE_DOFS           - Default ON
    USE_TEXTURES       - Default ON
    FAST_TEXTURES
    BEST_PERSP
    DISABLE_LOD
    SET_PICKING        - Default ON
    COLOR_STRIPS
    USE_FLT_AXIS
    DETACHABLE_DOF
PRINT_STATS tells the loader to compute some load statistics information and dum it to System.out.

FORCE_LOAD tells the loader to try to load the file even if the format or header is incorrect. This may be used for some FLT files that are not 15.4/15.6.

USE_FLT_OBJECTS tells the loader to use specialized FLT classes when building the tree. The classes are derived from Java3D classes, but contain addition info such as node name or switch masks. This release does provide minimal documentation for these nodes. FLTnodes universally have access to the node Name and any Comment information stored with the node in the FLT file.

USE_DOFS tells the loader to create FLTDOF objects. This is ON by default. This flag was added because sometimes when testing, the user may wish to NOT have DOFs inserted.

USE_TEXTURES tells the loader to load the textures associated with the database and apply them.

FAST_TEXTURES tells the loader that when using textures, set the texture attributes to the fastest render options.

BEST_PERSP tells the loader that when using textures, set the texture attributes to use the best perspective options.

DISABLE_LOD tells the loader disable the use of LOD nodes.

SET_PICKING tells the loader to set the Capability bit on all nodes loaded to allow for geometry collision checking and picking.

COLOR_STRIPS tells the loader to color Triangle Strips so they can be easily visualized.

USE_FLT_AXIS tells the loader to load the geometry/DOFs etc. in OpenFLT coordinate space i.e. X - to the right, Y - FORWARD, and Z - UP. This is different than Java3D's coordinate system which a traditional "Right-Handed" coordinate system i.e. X - to the right, Y - UP, Z - Out of the screen. Java3D coordinates are the default. This means that for Java3D, the "current, min and max" data in DOFs are swapped around. This makes sense because if FORWARD is no longer the Y axis as in Multigen's Creator, but the -Z axis, then the current, min and max data for the Y axis must be moved to the Z axis of the DOF for the data to make sense and be useable.

DETACHABLE_DOF tells the loader that when making DOFs, insert a extra BranchGroup above the DOF's three TransformGroups, in the intention that that node will be used for dynamically detaching from the scene.


Capability Bits
The CapabilityBits are set by the loader and are not configurable at this time other than enabling the SET_PICKING flag. They are set to allow the greatest possible access for picking and collisions.

Debug Level
There is a "debugLevel" varible that can be set directly. Levels supported are from 0 - 6, giving various output about the data during load. Default is 2.

If you have any specific questions regarding the loader's capabilities please send them to:
shawn.kendall@imilabs.com
